result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Anthony Cole-Breezee

records.addlTxt: Transcript of Preliminary hearing October 12,2022 pt. 2
Transcript of Preliminary hearing October 12,2022 pt. 1

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
9:22 AM Defendant Brandon Anthony Cole-Breezee in court, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Brandon Anthony Cole-Breezee.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State reviews file; continuation of preliminary hearing that had commenced last week 10/12/22. State reviews where hearing was paused.

State calls Detective Joel Markon, sworn and testifies
State screen shares exhibit 1-photo of gun 
screen shares proposed exhibit 2-photo detective took-O-R
screen shares proposed exhibit 3-photo of rifle recovered from the residence-O-R
Victim met with Detective at SPD in Douglas County WI
New Horizons Daycare in Douglas County WI
Residence where firearm seized in Douglas County WI
State verifies that exhibit 1 was received last week; Court indicates that is correct.

State final comments
Defense final comments

Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed, binds over for arraignment. Court reminds of bail/conditions.
Arraignment scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:41 AM Defendant Brandon Anthony Cole-Breezee in court, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Brandon Anthony Cole-Breezee.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State calls witness, Detective Joel Markon, S/T. State-direct examination of witness. Incident on October 6, 2022, City of Superior, Douglas County Wisconsin. Exhibits 1, 2 and 3 marked. Exhibit 1 shown to witness (photograph of firearm). Witness testifies regarding Exhibit 1. State offers Exhibit 1, no objection. Exhibit 1 received. Continued testimony regarding cell phone conversation between KCB and defendant. Witness identifies Defendant, no objection. Record reflects identification of defendant. Continued testimony. Exhibit 2 shown to witness (photo of room where gun was located). 
Court suddenly goes off record and parties are removed from courtroom.
Back on record at 10:09. Defendant was removed from courtroom due to incident. 
Court believes good cause to adjourn. 
Attorney Nelson agrees.
Court continues preliminary hearing.
Attorney Nelson indicates he will meet with client.
State makes statements. Addresses competency.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: no contact with Kira Cole Breezee, 511 Greenwood Avenue or child DCP, no use or possession of firearms, no contact with New Horizons Child Care Center.

1:45 PM Defendant Brandon Anthony Cole-Breezee appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ryan Reid appears in court for defendant. Attorney Allison Cogbill in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case. Attorney Reid acknowledges receipt, waives reading, pleads not guilty, requests preliminary hearing. Court accepts pleas.
State requests $25,000 cash, condition of no contact with Kira Cole Breezee, 511 Greenwood Avenue or child DCB, no firearms, no contact with New Horizons Child Care Center.  Defendant just got off probation in Minnesota. Unsure of ties to Douglas County. 
Attorney Reid asks for $1000 to $5000 cash bond. Resides in St. Louis County last 9 years. 
Court orders $25,000 cash, with conditions of no contact with Kira Cole Breezee, 511 Greenwood Avenue or child DCP, no possession or use firearms, no contact with New Horizons Child Care Center. Bail will be reviewed at preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 09:45 am.
